thread.title: Meryl Streep's Face After That Oscars Gaffe Should Win All The Awards
thread.title_full: Meryl Streep's Face After That Oscars Gaffe Should Win All The Awards

author: Bill Bradley
title: Meryl Streep's Face After That Oscars Gaffe Should Win All The Awards
text:
Meryl Streep's Face After That Oscars Gaffe Should Win All The Awards The award for Best Reaction goes to ... 
The error was eventually corrected, but the world still went nuts . The cast of “La La Land” tried to take it in stride , twist-ending expert M. Night Shyamalan took all the credit , and some celebs even compared the results to the 2016 election , but the award for Best Reaction goes to the legendary, “over-rated” Streep. 
You can glimpse it in the video above, but here’s a close-up of the actress after she heard the wrong Best Picture winner had been announced: Meryl Streep: still acting the most, even in a real life crisis pic.twitter.com/iczsyZwvzZ — Andrew Chow (@andrewrchow) February 27, 2017 
And here’s an even closer view: This was Meryl Streep's reaction to the Oscar mess-up I am DYING pic.twitter.com/ktLDGvRfmj 
Please just give her all the awards. 
There are so many emotions in such a short amount of time. 
meryl streep's face from that backstage #oscars feed when she realized what was happening with moonlight is hilarious pic.twitter.com/vivnECpMHj — karen (⊙ヮ⊙) (@magicrobins) February 27, 2017 
She’s shocked. She’s confused. She’s wondering if she left the stove on. She’s contemplating the meaning of life. She’s Meryl Streep. #MerylStreep déjà nommée aux Oscars 2018 pour sa réaction lorsque Moonlight a gagné face à La La Land pic.twitter.com/KiMPYi9W2W 
That’s how you get 20 Oscar nominations , people. 
Host Jimmy Kimmel dedicated a good portion of his opening monologue to Streep, joking that the actress was “mediocre” before inspiring the audience to give her a standing ovation. 
It looks like that ovation needs an encore. Meryl Streep won the Oscars. when your sibling does something wrong and your mom yells at you pic.twitter.com/ubasOYo13p — Spencer Althouse (@SpencerAlthouse) February 27, 2017 ALSO ON HUFFPOST:
